div.l: This wench lay vp riȝte and fast sclepe
That he so nyȝe was or she myȝte espy
That it had been to late for to cry
And shortly to sey the were atoon
Now pley Aleyn for I will speke of Iohn
This Iohn lijth still a furlong wey or to
And to hym selff he made rewth ⁊and woo
Allas quod he this is a wiccid Iape
Now may I sey that I am but an Ape
Ȝit hath my felaw soom what for his harm
He hath the Millers douȝtir on his Arme
And auntrith hym and hath his nede I sped
But I ly here as a draff sak in me bedd
And when this Iape is told a nothir day
I shall be hold a daff a Cokeney
¶ And I woll arise ⁊and auntir me be my fey
Vnhardy vnsely as men say
And vp he risith and sofftely he wente
Vn to the Cradill and in his armys it hente
And bare it sofftly onto his beddis fete
Sone aftir the wyff hir rowting lete
And gan a wake and went hir to pis
And com a geyn ⁊and gan hir cradill mys
And gropid and ther͗e cowd she fynd noon
Allas quod she I had al most mys goon
I had almost go to the clerkis bedd
A benedicite then had I evill spedd
And forth she goith till she the cradill fonde
She gropith al wey forth with hir honde
And fond the Clerkis bedd ⁊and þouȝt but good
Be cause the cradill by yt stode
And wist nat wher she was for it was derk
And feir ⁊and wele she crepith in to the clerk
And lay ful still and wold hav cauȝt a sclepe
